data.prompt:
Extract comprehensive customer insights from reviews about WiFi Connected Smart Switches.
The output format is JSON in English:
{
"phy": {
"<PHYSICAL>": {
"<PID>@<DETAIL>": {
"<SENT>": [ID, …]
}
}
},
"perf": {
"<PERF>": {
"<perf_id>@<DETAIL>": {
"<SENT>": {<PERF_REASON>: [ID, …]}
}
}
},
"use": {
"<USE>": {
"<SENT>": {<USE_REASON>: [ID, …]}
}
}
}

Definitions:
- <PID>: Unique ID for physical aspect ("phy"), starting from A. After Z, continue with AA, AB, and so on.
- <PHYSICAL>: Components or inherent physical properties of the WiFi Connected Smart Switches without external interaction (e.g. dimensions, appearance, material type...)
- <DETAIL>: A self-contained detail summarized from the reviews.
- <SENT>: Sentiment polarity of the current <DETAIL> (- for negative, + for positive).
- ID: All review IDs mentioning the <DETAIL>
- <perf_id>: Unique ID for performance or functions ("perf"), starting from a. After z, continue with aa, ab, and so on.
- <PERF>: The WiFi Connected Smart Switches' performance (e.g. flexibility, durability, ...) or behaviors under various conditions (e.g. temperature, force, chemicals...) without reference to any specific use case
- <PERF_REASON>: <PID> of the <PHYSICAL> explicitly mentioned as the cause of the <PERF>. Include all mentioned <PID>s. If no reason is mentioned, use "?". <PERF_REASON> and <PERF> should have the same sentiment polarity in the review where they are mentioned together (i.e. the same review ID are included at both locations)
- <USE>: The specific application, applicable object, method, tool, or environment for the product.
- <USE_REASON>: <perf_id> or <PID> causing the <USE>'s sentiment. Include all mentioned reasons, or "?" if none can be inferred. <USE_REASON> and <USE> should have the same sentiment polarity in the review where they are mentioned together.

CRITICAL INSTRUCTIONS:
- <PHYSICAL>/<PERF> and <DETAIL> MUST NOT include:
  * Generic statements without details (e.g., "good", "bad quality")
  * Issues unrelated to the product itself (e.g., "fast shipping", "delivery time")
- If a review mentions any physical aspect, related performance, or use together, extract them as separate entries under "phy," "perf," and "use," with no overlap.
- Make sure each <DETAIL> is under the most relevant <PHYSICAL> or <PERF> in the context of WiFi Connected Smart Switches
- Preserve negations

Key Instructions:
- Break down reviews with multiple aspects, performances, or uses into individual entries.
- Escape special characters with backslash that could cause JSON syntax errors.
- Include only explicitly mentioned reasons, and use "?" where no reason is mentioned.

Final Checklist:
- Go through all reviews and ensure that no aspect, performance, use, or reason is omitted, even if only mentioned once.
- Review all entries to ensure proper separation between aspects, performances, and uses.

Print the JSON result only.
Input format:
<ID>#<review>

[[INPUT]]
0#Work Great With Home Assistant. I've installed 14 of these around the house so far and 3 of the companion switches for 3 & 4 way lighting circuits. They were easy to install (need a neutral wire but that is normal for smart switches), well made and paired instantly with the Zigbee integration on Home Assistant. They provide basic power monitoring (instantaneous and summation) and function as Zigbee routers which helps provide a stable network. So far their function and been flawless.
1#works, but only sometimes (which is worse than not working at all). I bought a number of these for our old house, and they worked great. This year, I moved to a new house and bought 13 of them to replace the switches in the house. We were having some work done on the house, so I bought them and asked the electrical guy to install them. By the time he was able to install them, my 30 day return window had closed so I'm not able to return them. But if I could, I would! None of them work correctly. If you turn them on or off, it's anyone's guess if they will work the next time you need to change from on to off (or off to on). I spent 20 minutes last night poking the off button on the switch trying to turn off my bathroom lights so I could go do bed. I was almost in tears by the time they finally worked. The blue indicator light is supposed to turn on when the switch is off, but right now my kitchen light switch is showing as "off", but the kitchen light is on. They become "unavailable" in my home automation a number of times a day, which is not endearing home automation to anyone in my house. Everyone told me that when this company was purchased by GE the quality had fallen. I didn't believe them. Don't be me. Get a different smart switch for your house. Or at least install them before the 30 day period is up!
2#I'm a loser for loving these! These work great for standard or 3 way switches. Act as zigbee routers which saved my zigbee network from ruin. Replacing some older wifi switches with these guys. A little spendy but I don't do anything else but work and fiddle with my home anymore. Don't judge!!! Ok fine I'm a loser!!!
3#No Functional Switch. I have purchased two of these switches over the years, and neither of them functioned as intended. They failed to pair and were unable to perform basic tasks such as turning the lights on or off. The wiring was correctly installed and tested in multiple locations. These switches were intended to replace older GE/Jasco models, which had worked reliably for approximately 15 years. Despite using identical wiring configurations, these new switches would not respond at all. I confirmed that they were receiving power, as indicated by the illuminated LED light at the bottom. However, the switches themselves remained non-operational. When I installed an old GE switch, using the exact same wiring setup, it worked without any issues.
4#Great Zigbee switch for HA. Fantastic zigbee switches that follow the Zigbee specs; I've found these work better than Aqara ones
5#Solves a problem automating my 3-way light wiring! Searched far and wide for a 3-way switch solution that could meet my criteria. - Had to match the ivory color decor of all the other switches in our home. - I wanted to avoid wifi switches and stick to Zigbee. I've already got HomeKit, Home Assistant with Zigbee and Phillips Hue in the house so I wanted to avoid another hub. - Had to work with my wiring. More on that below. Note: this is referring to wiring in the USA. Now of course since I already have Hue I could have replaced all of the recessed ceiling lights in the room with Hue and gone with Hue switches but with 9 fixtures on just this one 3-way that would have cost a fortune! I just wanted to automate the switch and keep the existing lights. The included ivory switch paddle was super easy to swap out. I also purchased the matching add-on switch for the 3-way setup which also included an ivory paddle. The total cost def higher than Zigbee relays I've been using for single switch automation but there is no way I could get those to work with my 3-way wiring. Installation was pretty easy. The issue with my 3-way wiring is the supply is in first box and the load in the other "end of run" box. The end of run box had no supply in it. Luckily this smart switch only needs one of the two existing traveler wires to connect to the add-on switch so I was able to use the second traveler (I used the black) to transfer supply to the end of run box (where the load is) and put the smart switch there. The add-on switch went in the box with the supply and connected to the smart switch via the red traveler. The installation instructions include a number of wiring configurations and overall are pretty good. However if this configuration was shown in the directions I didn't see it. That said it wasn't hard to figure out. I looked at a lot of other options and none of them could handle this scenario. I also really like the fact this switch uses momentary contact on/off. I find that to be a tad more intuitive than "dumb" 3-way switches where one switch is always in the "on" position. The blue led on the smart switch is on by default when the light is off and it is pretty bright. This is ok for some rooms however I would not want this in a bedroom. It is easy to change the behavior so the led is on when the light is on and off when the light is off. Press 'on' 3 times quickly then 'off' on the smart switch. This toggles the led behavior. Hopefully it lasts. Time will tell. Just one minor con: The included ivory switch paddle is a tad lighter in shade than my other switches and switch plates. But it's a minor difference and no where near as ugly as a white switch would have looked. The wife says that is just my OCD showing and of course she's right. I will be purchasing more of these to automate additional 3 & 4 way switch setups in the house.
6#Well made, easy to install, and easy to use. I have two of these now. I'll probably be replacing some other switches with the same product as well. They are easy to install and it paired easily with Home Assistant. It installs just as eaily as any other light swith, maybe easier actually. No bending of wires or anything. You do need a neutral in the box, but that's not usually a big deal in a modern home. Basically as soon as the power came on my HA found the device and I had it up and running in less than a minute. The signal strength seems good. and they react instantly to the automations I've set up. No complaints at all.
7#Direct replacement for GE Zigbee Smart Switch. Bought 2 of these to replace my 6 year old GE Zigbee 3 way switches, that stopped working within a week of each other. Installation was a breeze. Discovery with Alexa was a pain in the behind. Took 3 tries on first switch then 5 or more times for 2nd switch. After pairing they work just as good as GE and are compatible with the slave switches on the circuit. Same switch, different company.
8#Enbrighten Zigbee Smart Light Switch. I installed this switch at my back door to control external porch lights. I have a number of Zigbee devices in my home, namely Aqara door/window sensors that I use to control a variety of door related automations. While Aqara does offer an equivalent Zigbee wall switch to this Enbrighten model, the Aqara switch has a Decora sized on/off pushbutton switch that is not particularly attractive and has a mushy feel to it. I like that this Enbrighten switch has a more standard looking paddle appearance to it, making it "blend in" better with existing "dumb" paddle switches in my multi-gang box, and offering a more intuitive appearance and operation similar to a "dumb" paddle for those unfamiliar with smart switches. The switch installs easily, and I like that it has multiple wire entries at each screw terminal - the screw terminals are a clamp down style, meaning straight wires push in on either side of the screw terminal, and the screw tightens down on the wires, holding them firmly in place. I was able to unbundle my 2 wire-nutted "hots" and use one of the hot terminal screws to capture both of them, eliminating the need for a pigtail to be added to the "hot" bundle and run to the switch - the screw terminal captures "pass through" duties for the hot wires and also powers the switch - good stuff. ALL connections are done via screw terminals(hot, switched, neutral and ground), meaning no wire leads coming off the switch itself, which I find leads to better cable management within the box. I did add a white "pigtail" lead off the neutral bundle by twisting the pigtail on to that bundle and replacing the wire nut, as the white bundle contained more than two wires. I added the switch via a Zigbee dongle and ZHA to my Home Assistant box - pairing was easy, when I opened up the "add device" option in HA, the switch immediately advertised itself to the Zigbee dongle, without any need to put the switch in to any kind of pairing mode. I did not bother adding any kind of Enbrighten app to my phone - the switch paired locally and that's exactly what I am looking for as I pursue an entirely local smart home. Being a mains-wired Zigbee device, this switch acts as a Zigbee radio/repeater - I have an Aqara door/window sensor in my curbside mailbox, and it easily joined to the switch's radio/repeater to facilitate my "You've got mail" automation that announces the mail's arrival on my voice assistant. Previously, I had an Aqara smart plug providing this radio/repeater connectivity to the mailbox, but I wanted an in-wall switch as the smart plug was serving no other function other than to act as a radio/repeater to the mailbox. I exposed the switch to Alexa through my Nabu Kasa account in order to integrate it with a eufy doorbell cam so that the porch light controlled by this switch can be turned on overnight if the doorbell detects motion. The switch is also controlled by a HA automation, which turns the same porch light on at dusk and off at 10PM - everything is working fine. Please note that the switch has a blue LED - by default, it is on when the switch is off, and off when the switch is on - that can easily be overridden to on when on and off when off by 3 rapid "on" presses of the upper paddle followed by a single press of the off paddle. I prefer the blue LED to be off when the light is off, and this would be especially true in a bedroom, where I imagine it would be quite annoying to have the blue LED glowing when trying to sleep. Reviewers complaining about the blue LED should be aware of this. This switch is a bit pricy, but the Aqara version is similarly priced, and as I mentioned, I think the Enbrighten has a more intuitive and ergonomic feel to it versus Aqara's giant mushy pushbutton approach.
9#New Zigbee switch for the bathroom heater. No more getting up early to go turn on the bathroom heater. I’ve used this to set up an automation in our old house that turns on the bathroom heater at a preset time, as well as automatically turn it off after 30 minutes. It also measures wattage and reports in Home Assistant, which is cool.
10#AVOID TERRIBLE TECH SUPPORT. YOU WILL GET A MESSAGE EVERY TIME YOU CALL THEIR TECH SUPPORT SAYING THEY ARE IN A MEETING TO BETTER THEIR SUPPORT. HOW DOES NEVER BEING AVAILABLE BETTER YOUR SUPPORT??? $50 for a light switch thats complete and utter GARBAGE!!!!!! AVOID AT ALL COSTS. ITS NOT WORTH THE STRESS!!!!!
11#Works well. Will not fit in super shallow wall or box. Fits in average sized electrical box. Responsive, doesn't drop connection. Used with Homeassistant.
12#Works great with Homeassistant! I have a ZHA stick and use Home assistant and it works great and super responsive.
13#These are great for HomeAssistant and automations. I bought 3 of these, one for my back porch lights, and then 2 for my garage inside lights. My kids LOVE going out there and then leaving the light on. They connected right away with no problems, and I am working on motion sensors and automation so that they turn off when there has been no motion. I set up an automation so my back porch lights turn on when there is motion between sunset and sunrise and these switches are responsive and quick. The old TP-Link I replaced would take 20-30 seconds sometimes to turn on, which meant I was already almost in the door anyways. If you are into the Zigbee ecosystem and need some switches, these are fantastic.
14#Better and more permanent than light bulbs. I have enbrighten switches all through my house, about half Z wave and half Zigbee. With the coverage they provide I never worry if a new device can make a connection. Also, I prefer these to the Wi-Fi switches since I already have so many devices on my Wi-Fi network.
15#Enbrighten App doesn’t support these switches. The switches work for basic on and off functions. However, my switches are not smart or intuitive. The QR code on the switch says that they are not supported by the Enbrighten App. Putting them in pairing mode is not intuitive and doesn’t seem to work. The help line is non-responsive and has limited hours.
16#Neutered by the manufacturer. Beware if you are a power user. I have a lot of Zigbee 3.o devices and this is the worst. I use a home assistant smart home box. It has Zigbee Home Assistant built in. They have disabled the voice control because they want you to go direct to your smart speakers. I put it in Zigbee2MQTT and I can do more but once installed it get errors trying to update the device. I have some installed that I can't return but they will be swapped out with a better Inovelli switch.
17#Working great with Homeassistant using the Zigbee2MQTT addon. Installed these yesterday, installation was simple and pairing was easy too. The switches work just about instantaneously, both with the physical wall switch and over Zigbee. They are so responsive that they toggle before I have even finished lifting my finger from the phone screen of the app I use to control them.
18#Excellent Zigbee Smart Switch with Easy Integration. The Enbrighten Zigbee Smart Light Switch is excellent in terms of performance and ease of use. It pairs seamlessly with my home assistant setup. While it is a bit overpriced, the reliability and functionality make it worth considering. Highly recommend for anyone looking to upgrade their smart home system!
19#So far so good. Audible click on the relay. Not terrible but expect it to be there. Clean. Has both bone/white switches. Fits in a 4 gang box just fine.
20#Downgraded dimmer over priced. This is the exact same hardware as the dimmer except it just has on off functionality. Then the price is bumped up. Very disappointing when you want something that is just a switch and you want proper paddle functionality. You're better off getting the dimmer and disabling dimming in the software.
21#Works with generic Zigbee hub and Home Assistant. Had no troubles
22#Open Box Sold as New. I received a box that was previously opened. I double-checked the product post description and saw nothing about this item being refurbished. For $43, I expected this item to be brand new. I will install the switch later this week, and hopefully, it will work. If it does, I will keep it, but I feel I should be reimbursed for $10 for a used product. If it does not work, I will be returning it. Stay tuned for my review update. It works but I paid full price for a refurbished product. I still believe a discount should be provided.
23#It needs a Hub and does not have its own app. very disappointed that after i installed.. could not find the Zigbee app to install and also found out. that is needs to buy a HUB to connect with the phone app.
24#3 of 7 devices failed within 6 months. Title says it all. I'm removing all of these because they keep failing. Nothing worse then having your son's bedroom light unable to turn off and having to monkey around with breakers to reset these. So much regret that I didn't go with Lutron.
25#Underwhelming design for the price. Pros: Appears to work well as a zigbee router/repeater. Cons: Blue LED when there is no load, and unable to turn that off. Only reports on or off. Does not sense bouble and triple taps, nor does it report long holds.
26#Easy setup and install. Swapped out a regular decora switch for this one and was able to pair it with my Hubitat C8 base almost immediately. Controls the light in my pantry and with the addition of a door sensor my pantry light now turns on and off automatically when the doors are opened and closed.
27#An easy and simple install, you'll love it! Install was super fast with the SimpleWire setup. Instantly paired with Home Assistant and zigbee2mqtt. You can also control the blue status LED (3 quick taps on top paddle, then 1 quick tap on bottom) which makes this product perfect!
28#Doesn’t work. Doesn’t work after installation and I double checked the wiring. Hopefully what Amazon sends as a replacement works. But then, what a waste of time.
29#Works great, pairs easily with Home assistant. Great switch, I'm using it with Home Assistant connected to Combee II gateway and ZHA integration. So far have 3 of these but will definitely buy more.
30#Most Reliable. I have tried other Zigbee devices and they failed during installation or failed shortly after while in use. These GE (Jasco) switches are easy to install and last forever (almost). I had one fail after a couple of years and they sent me a free replacement. Wifi switches are slower to respond and too many wifi devices may be a challenge for routers.
31#Easy to use. Wonderful to program and use!
32#Worked exactly as promised. Immediate connection with my Zigbee hub and all functions working. Worked as promised, no issues.
33#Does not work. Switch does not work. Replaced with zigbee inline switch and that worked immediately. Do not buy this model.
